subject: Science
title: Transformers: Stepping Voltage Up and Down
description: A fast breakdown of Transformers: Stepping Voltage Up and Down for builders.

hook.text: Power lines carry electricity at 400,000 volts. Your outlet delivers 120. Transformers bridge the gap.

buildup.text: A transformer uses two coils of wire wrapped around an iron core.

discovery.text: AC in one coil creates a changing magnetic field that induces voltage in the second coil.

twist.text: More turns in the second coil means higher voltage. Fewer turns means lower voltage. It's just a ratio.

climax.text: Without transformers, electricity couldn't travel more than a few km from the power plant.

punchline.text: Two coils and a chunk of iron. That simple device makes the entire power grid possible.

quiz.question: How does a transformer change voltage?
options: By using different numbers of wire turns in two coils
By adding resistance to the circuit
